message: Last year it was very expensive to park in the Hyatt garage. They wouldn't put the fee on my room, so I had to run to an ATM before I could get my car back.  Are there any long-term parking alternatives?
don't park at the Hyatt! $27 a day hurts :) I ended up paying $5 per day here: http://www.atlantadowntown.com/go/31-baker-street
it is one block away and it was perfect
@doughellmann That's what you pay the extra @22 for ...
@holdenweb That's what I thought. I'll be parking at the hotel again. Still cheaper than a ticket to Chicago. :-)

I'm planning to park at a Marta station and come by train to Peachtree station. $8/day at most marta stations makes it a pretty good option. Have done this a number of times previously and its pretty safe. 2 min. walk from Peachtree station to the venue.
I know there is a parking lot, 1 block south from the hotel, and it was pretty cheap. However if you need overnight parking I don't think they have that. As we used that only during the day.

@Koding Parking at any Marta station is free if for less than 24 hours. And some stations (e.g. Doraville) have parking garages with security, Marta weekly pass is $17, you have to move the car once a day. You do the math.
If you are flying in, the MARTA (subway) goes directly into the basement of the hotel!
That's exactly what I did and worked great.  Bought a round trip.  The MARTA station is right by the baggage claim.

@joeTennies not 100% accurate. Peachtree Center Station, then go to the mall then take the caseway to the hotel. But yea :) It's a brease, and you go against traffic if you arrive in the afternoon, so not to many people in the trains.
